result.execSummary:
The defendant Saxon D Perry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Court orders restitution in the amount of $110.00 payable to Dorothy R.
*Pay all applicable costs, surcharges and assessments. The court orders all financial obligations to be paid within 2 years (by 08/28/17); any remaining balance to convert to a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: Straight time.
Court orders the defendant turned over to Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to transport to the House of Corrections upon completion of prison sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Saxon D Perry in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Saxon D Perry in custody.  
Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

COUNT 1:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

Statements made as to sentencing.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 180 DAYS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE, STRAIGHT TIME with credit for 0 DAYS time served.  The Court orders the defendant turned over to Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to transport to the House of Corrections upon completion of prison sentence.

The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments.  The Court orders restitution in the stipulated amount of $110.00 payable to Dorothy. R.  The Court orders all financial obligations  to be paid within 2 years (by 8-28-17); any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Order to Produce for Plea/Sentencing Hearing on August 26, 2015 @ 1:30pm  Received and Filed

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Saxon D Perry not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Saxon D Perry not in court, in custody and not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Court is in jury trial for today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Saxon D Perry not in court, in custody and not produced.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Defendant Saxon D Perry in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Saxon D Perry in custody.  
Gary D Mahkorn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  
Defendant plead not guilty, reserving right of substitution.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
